column5: Well in preparation for the upcoming ice season I've checked my trusty boots and noticed a small less than an inch cut on the front upper portion...not sure but may have done with with my power auger last ice season and never noticed it....any ideas on the best way to repair it as otherwise the boots are serving me very well.  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
I did the same last year and put a 2" gash in mine. Grab a tube of shoo goo from Canadian Tire and have at er.
marine goop, which is basically shoe goo, pretty sure it's the same thing

As kids on the farm growing up, our rubber boots and the barb wire fences were always a bad mix. Parents would have been broke trying to keep us in new boots. They use to take ours into the local tire shop for patching. It wasn't uncommon to have 4 or 5 patches on a pair before you out grew them.
X2 on the shoe goo, CTC
Hey Buddy....been there,done that,and the goop is the way to go....waders and my ice boots have both been introduced...lol....TC...Chuck...
and so you have been told I have a tube at home for just about anything because it works so well.
I like the goop a lot better than shoe goo. It will seal anything up. Goood stuff for sure!!  S.
thanks guys. Appreciate the advice, will visit CT tomorrow to see what they have...  Cheers, Ice Fisherman
I have used Aqua Seal with excellent success on my 20 year old plus hip waders  WR

Goop or Goo with little rubber patch.  The Red Green that sucka down with some duct tape just for coolness effect.  Any guy wearing duct tapes on his boots ain't no ice fishing poser.  That's fo' shnizzle!
aquaseal works wonders on my waders...

how long does the aqueseal last for you guys? I find it'll crack after a few seasons, never liked it  for on the water fixes i have the loon UV glue and light....works well enough to get through the day but not long term IMO
